mods:mods.mods:abstract: The deponent said he first heard of Clinton's Old Line when he went to live on the west side of the drowned lands. He believes that the persons named in Exhibit 52, who lived near the said line, must have heard of it. Neither he nor other persons named in Exhibit 52, had, to his knowledge, any leases or paid any rent for their lands when he first went to live in the drowned lands. The greater part of the inhabitants of Warwick hold their lands only by possession. The deponent said that 27 or 28 years ago his brother, Joseph Knap refused to settle in Warwick/south of Clinton's line and erect a mill there because Colonel Clinton told him not to buy land under a New York title there. When the deponent first settled in Warwick, south of Clinton's Old Line, he became acquainted with Lawrence Decker, Thomas Blaine, and Samuel Vance. Signed, Jonathan Knap. In Jay's hand.
mods:mods.mods:note: The entire content of the original has been digitized.
mods:mods.mods:accessCondition: For rights relating to this resource, visit http://www.columbia.edu/cu/lweb/digital/jay/copyright.html
